JOB SUMMARY The Accounting Manager is a critical role to contribute in various areas of general accounting policy and procedure, taxation and Internal Control will assist Plant Controller to effectively ensure company are fully compliant with internal and external protocol. Conduct periodic balance sheet and internal control reviews o    Identify opportunities for improvement in internal controls and efficiency o    Develop, standardize, and implement policies and procedures. o    Work closely with the counterparties and Internal Audit to ensure accounting processes are efficient and in compliance with Company policy, US GAAP and Sarbanes Oxley (SOX). o    Provide quarterly review & audit schedules and support for external and internal audits o    Continuously review accounting processes for efficiency and internal control improvements o    Maintain a strong understanding of applicable legislation and guidance. o    Responsible in related Treasury and Tax activities o    Anticipate and pro-actively address contemporary Controller related topics o    Assist in various controllership related activities o    Lead and support ad hoc projects Requirements for a typical Job Holder / Applicant Educational Degree     Bachelor degree in Accounting/Finance plus CPD or equivalent preferred Professional Experience (in what processes and function) o    10 years of Accounting and Taxation and/or audit experience, preferably in a Big 4 or large multinational manufacturing organization o    Possess efficient work ethics with proven ability to meet deadlines Ability to learn on the fly in a dynamic and rapidly evolving organization o    Strong collaboration and influencing skills demonstrated through superior communication and presentation skills, both oral and written Special Qualifications, Knowledge & Skills o    Fluent in written and spoken English. Additional Asian languages are a plus (e.g. Japanese). o    Experience in SAP o    Good communication and presentation skills. Company Description At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible. At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that. Our technology helped people put a man on the moon. We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest growth organizations in the world. From energizing the most competitive gaming platforms, to enabling systems to make cities safer and cars smarter and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and public cloud, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future. Binge-watch any shows, use social media or shop online lately? You’ll find Western Digital supporting the storage infrastructure behind many of these platforms. And, that flash memory card that captures and preserves your most precious moments? That’s us, too. We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, storage devices and platforms for business and consumers alike. Our data-centric solutions are comprised of the Western Digital®, G-Technology™, SanDisk® and WD® brands. Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. It’s You & Western Digital. Together, we’re the next BIG thing in data. Job Description ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Track and determine Manufacturing Variance by analyzing actual results in comparison with forecasts. The sum of all variances represents the overall over- or under-performance for a particular reporting period. Determine trends for each individual cost element. Prepare weekly, monthly and quarterly various reports and flux analysis Responsible for Quarterly Standard Cost set up and New items Compile and analyze data in connection with the quarterly standard cost updates Responsible for Monthly/quarterly financial close activities Maintain and review the general ledger and reconcile balance sheet accounts Daily/weekly/quarterly cost accounting related activities: Analyze quarterly standard costs revaluations Ensure compliance with corporate SOX and key controls, adherence to US GAAP (Generally accepted accounting principles) and other statutory requirements and support for audit requirements Supporting special projects, ad-hoc analysis, and any other tasks assigned by Manager Qualifications REQUIRED: Bachelor/Master degree majored in Accounting or Finance Minimum 5 years working experience as cost accountant in multinational company PREFERRED: Experience working in a manufacturing company SKILLS: Good command of English both in writing and speaking Able to handle multiple tasks, strong interpersonal skills and good teamwork Efficient in Microsoft Excel and Power Point Experience in Oracle Cloud is a plus Able to work under pressure and meet the requirement of deadline Additional Information Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity.
